docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges developed a moderately higher trend last week in contrast to the general irregularity and new lows established in the preceding fortnight. Bankers ascribed the rally to the disappearance of the nervousness over the international...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges developed a moderately higher trend last week in contrast to the general irregularity and new lows established in the preceding fortnight. Bankers ascribed the rally to the disappearance of the nervousness over the international situation, this calmness being heightened at the week-end by reports of concessions by Czechoslovakia in the dispute with the Sudeten Germans and the appointment of the latter group to minor government posts.

docs.snippet: Undeclared wars rage in two continents while the nation observes this week the tenth anniversary of the Kellogg pact designed to outlaw war. Historians say that the Kellogg pact, intended to eliminate war "as an instrument of national policy," has...
docs.lead_paragraph: Undeclared wars rage in two continents while the nation observes this week the tenth anniversary of the Kellogg pact designed to outlaw war. Historians say that the Kellogg pact, intended to eliminate war "as an instrument of national policy," has had the unfortunate effect of producing a new type of conflictthe undeclared war and even the concealed war.
docs.abstract: U S observes 10th anniv of Kellogg-Briand Peace Pact (Pact of Paris); pact blamed for new type of undeclared war

docs.snippet: The new "good neighbor" fleet of merchant liners to South America was characterized as a symbol of what the Maritime Commission hopes to accomplish in the rehabilitation of other American flag services in foreign commerce by Admiral Emory S. Land,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The new "good neighbor" fleet of merchant liners to South America was characterized as a symbol of what the Maritime Commission hopes to accomplish in the rehabilitation of other American flag services in foreign commerce by Admiral Emory S. Land, chairman of the commission, in an address tonight over the Columbia Broadcasting System.

docs.snippet: The Latin-American Trade Union Congress, opening in Mexico City on Sept. 5, was denounced today by William Green, president of the American Federation of Labor, as a device of "extreme leftists" for spreading communism through the Western Hemisphere.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Latin-American Trade Union Congress, opening in Mexico City on Sept. 5, was denounced today by William Green, president of the American Federation of Labor, as a device of "extreme leftists" for spreading communism through the Western Hemisphere.
